text: Rena Small (born 1954) is an American conceptual artist who works primarily in photography. Small is best known for her ongoing series The Artists' Hands Continuum, consisting of black and white photographs of the hands of well- known artists. She began the project in 1994. ==Collections== *George Eastman Museum *J. Paul Getty Museum *Los Angeles County Museum of Art *Norton Simon Museum *Princeton University Art Museum *RISD Museum *Seattle Art Museum ==References== Category:1954 births Category:20th-century American women artists Category:21st-century American women artists Category:20th-century American photographers Category:American conceptual artists Category:Living people
title: Rena Small
